results.title: The Dancing feet
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, V. Shantaram and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The role of the dance in Indian life. People of rural India singing and dancing together. Dances of different regions brought together in this film include Gujerat, Kulu, Kerala, eastern India, Deccan Kashmir and Rajasthan and the Punjab.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A. Bhaskar Rao, V. Shantaram and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Opens Wednesday
results.creator_credit: Barrie Nelson and Barrie Nelson Productions
results.brief_description: Opens Wednesday is a romp through a director’s rehearsal of a lively animated show. Nelson’s animated transformations are intimate and spectacular. Partial funding by the American Film Institute and National Endowment for the Arts.

results.title: Hokusai: an animated sketch book
results.creator_credit: Tony White and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: An animated tribute to an “old man mad about drawing”, Japanese artist, Katsushika Hokusai, 1760-1849, which explores 60 of the 30 thousand drawings he is reputed to have produced during his lifetime. Narrated by Michael Bates. Voice of Hokusai: Eric Chitty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony White and Arts Council of Great Britain

results.title: Island
results.brief_description: From a description of what it is like for black prisoners in the South African gaol ‘The Island’, the unreasonableness of apartheid is shown. It was also here that Nelson Mandela was held captive for many years. The film examines the role of language (as an expression of the penal code, social convention, metaphysics) in political repression and challenges the viewer with an unconventional combination of first-person oral history accounts, music, still images and computer graphics.

results.title: Lay lady lay
results.creator_credit: J. Hekrdla, Vladimir Jirawck and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: Presents a clever, animated statement on morale and productivity, two key problems in every business field. An overworked hen is rejuvenated after a visit to her company psychiatrist.

results.title: The Animation game
results.brief_description: Designed for teachers and students, this film is an introduction to animating on film. Covers drawn, model, cut-out and pixilation animation techniques. Geoffrey Rush stars as the Professor. Animation by David Johnson. Suitable for upper primary, secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Rural industries
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
Australia’s modern techniques of cultivation and harvesting are demonstrated to show how this country is a major supplier of grain to the world. The film also shows how the cattle and livestock industry supply food to most parts of the globe.
